Code Base¶

bin¶

db¶

The Database module.

Handles the abstraction of reading and writing the results of the tests.

I will start by using XML

the request method allows us to request previous test results

openkimtests.bin.db.XMLReader(filename=None, test=None, potential=None, element=None, full=False)[source]¶

This method unpacks results to a dictionary, using json for the serialization

openkimtests.bin.db.XMLWriter(potential, element, test, results, write=False)[source]¶

This method packages the results dictionary into our standard XML Format. The layout is roughly as follows

<test id=’TestName’>
<config>
<potential> PotentialName </potential>
<element> Element Symbol </element>
</config>
<results>
<FirstResultKey type=’type’> FirstResultValue </FirstResultKey>
<SecondResultKey type=’type’> SecondResultValue </SecondResultKey>
...
</results>
</test>
openkimtests.bin.db.get_by_element(element, cands=None)[source]¶

Get all of the results by element

openkimtests.bin.db.get_by_potential(potential, cands=None)[source]¶

Get all of the results by potential name

openkimtests.bin.db.get_by_test(test, cands=None)[source]¶

Get all of the results by test name

openkimtests.bin.db.reader(filename=None, test=None, potential=None, element=None, full=False)¶

This method unpacks results to a dictionary, using json for the serialization

openkimtests.bin.db.request(potential, element, test, resultentry)[source]¶

Get the results from a potential, element, test pair

openkimtests.bin.db.results_exist(potential, element, test)[source]¶

See if results exist

openkimtests.bin.db.results_timestamp(potential, element, test)[source]¶

Get the creation time of a results file

openkimtests.bin.db.writer(potential, element, test, results, write=False)¶

This method packages the results dictionary into our standard XML Format. The layout is roughly as follows

<test id=’TestName’>
<config>
<potential> PotentialName </potential>
<element> Element Symbol </element>
</config>
<results>
<FirstResultKey type=’type’> FirstResultValue </FirstResultKey>
<SecondResultKey type=’type’> SecondResultValue </SecondResultKey>
...
</results>
</test>

filetools¶

A collection os useful file utilities

openkimtests.bin.filetools.file_list(dir)[source]¶

List the valid python files inside a directory

logger¶

Holds the logger for the openkimtest project
in logger, to be inherited by other modules and a child created e.g. child_logger = logger.getChild(‘child_name’)

potential¶

The potential module.

Handles the loading of potentials from ASE, KIM, and LAMMPS

openkimtests.bin.potential.ASAP_loader(name, element, slab=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load ASAP potential

openkimtests.bin.potential.EMT_loader(name, element, slab=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load an ASE EMT potential

openkimtests.bin.potential.GPAW_loader(name, element, slab=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load the GPAW calculator

openkimtests.bin.potential.KIM_loader(name, element, slab=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load a KIM Potential

openkimtests.bin.potential.LAMMPS_loader(name, element, slab=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load LAMMPS calculator

exception openkimtests.bin.potential.PackageDoesNotExist[source]¶

Raised if a package cannot be loaded

exception openkimtests.bin.potential.PotentialLoadFailed(name, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Raised if the calculator failed to initialize

exception openkimtests.bin.potential.UnknownPotential[source]¶

Raised if a package cannot be loaded

exception openkimtests.bin.potential.UnsupportedAtom[source]¶

Raised if a package cannot be loaded

openkimtests.bin.potential.kim_file_atoms(model)[source]¶

Given a KIM Model name, read the .kim file to get the supported atoms

openkimtests.bin.potential.load(name, element=None, slab=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Allow dictionary like access
